alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 19 at 9:05AM HST until July 19 at 12:15PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: The National Weather Service in Honolulu has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County * Until 1215 PM HST. * At 905 AM HST, rain gages indicated that rainfall is still occurring over the slopes of the Kau District, but accumulations have been less than half an inch over the past hour. Hawaii County Civil Defense reported that Kaalaiki Road and Wood Valley Road near Pahala remain closed. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Emergency management. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Wood Valley, Pahala, Punaluu Beach, Kawa Flats, Naalehu, Hawaii Volcanoes National Park, Waiohinu, Hawaii Volcanoes Park Kahuku Unit and Discovery Harbour. This warning may need to be extended beyond 1215 PM HST if flooding persists. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
